page.title: 07OLD BOARDING HOUSES HERNEBAY
page.content: In 1985 there are no longer sufficient residential holiday makers to fill the old boarding houses which still line the Herne Bay seafront. Many of these buildings are tall and expensive to maintain and although some are now just private houses, usually they are too large for the average family and their use is rather more varied. Sometimes a family might live in the lower part of the house and keep an upper flat to be let out to students or holiday makers. Sometimes the whole house is divided into small flats often with students from Canterbury University paying from Â£20 a week for a room with a shared bathroom and kitchen. Also some of the larger houses have been turned into old people's homes.
